programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum takes a case from fellow private investigator Luther Gillis to find the true identity of a man's comatose fiancée when he learns that she's had extensive facial surgery.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: An art connoisseur and close friend of Higgins who recently hired Magnum to test his security is murdered, and Thomas is arrested as the main suspect.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: TC asks Magnum to take on a case to help acquit the father of one of TC's young football players who is accused of murder.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: An aging tycoon asks Magnum to find his lost love, who he says just recently contacted him -- but she died 30 years earlier; Rick and TC meet a fellow vet who is having a hard time adjusting to civilian life.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: When Magnum takes the case of a little girl's missing cat, he stumbles upon another cat's murdered owner.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman who owns local slums hires Nick to investigate her son's girlfriend. Nick soon questions whether he's working for the right people.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A con man cheats one of Nick's friends out of his retirement fund. Nick decides to help his friend return the favor. What they don't know is that the mob is involved.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A successful businessman fights with his wife a lot. When she is found dead, he is the prime suspect, so he hires Nick and Sylvie to prove his innocence. His business partner and even his kids are among the other potential suspects.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick and Sylvie are hired by an insurance company to investigate a porn mogul who bought life insurance for one of his girls just before she was murdered. As Nick and Sylvie soon find out, the hole goes much deeper than that.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: The recently fired DEA Agent & Ex-Royal Canadian Mounted Police Officer, Nick Slaughter, moves to the Florida beach resort town of Key Mariah & opens a detective agency with a feisty local travel agent named Sylvie Girard! Their first case comes when an old friend of Nick's from the Philadelphia Police department asks them to help catch a killer!

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: When Sue and the team search for the source of a new designer drug, they cross paths with a win-at-all-costs Bounty Hunter (guest star Ron Lea from 'Doc') - who has a score to settle with Jack.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue is shocked to discover her friend Troy (Deaf actor - and Deanne Bray's real-life husband - Troy Kotsur) has been arrested for armed robbery - a crime he swears he didn't commit.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a body is discovered at a popular nightclub, everyone is a suspect.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Six months after starting a new life with her family, Brennan becomes interested in a case to which she has personal ties; an FBI investigation begins when Booth goes missing.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A feud between a famous author (Robert Vaughn) and his sixth wife, Charmaine (Marcia Cross), turns into a criminal case when Charmaine is faced with allegations of abuse; Barba winds up dealing with family drama of his own.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When Carisi's sister's fiancé falls back into bad habits and accuses his parole officer of rape, Carisi must investigate.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: During an interview on a popular TV show, a college student claims she was gang raped in a fraternity, bringing national attention to rape on campus; Benson and Barba investigate multiple suspects.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Barba's efforts to make an arrest in a case involving pornographic photos is stalled when several suspects come down with the measles; Amaro receives distressing news about his son.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Voight and members of the Chicago PD travel to New York to help SVU pursue Yates, their prime suspect in a rape/murder case.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman wants to recant her testimony and free her father, who was incarcerated for incest and rape when she was a child; Capt. Cragen, who remembers the original investigation, tries to help the team.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Efforts to find an 8-year-old boy kidnapped for ransom are hindered by tension between the child's estranged parents; Sgt. Benson is asked to take the lieutenant's exam and officially become the leader of the squad.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When Johnny D (Charles Halford) is on trial for sex trafficking, rape, assault and kidnapping, Noah's adoption becomes involved with the case, causing Benson to fear for the child's future; a threat could permanently change the squad.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Detective Rollins hopes to elicit a confession from serial killer Gregory Yates (Dallas Roberts) when a body washes up on the beach where he buried victims, but the information he provides sends shock waves through the police department.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Detectives continue to investigate a woman's murder and dismemberment by following a lead provided by serial killer Gregory Yates.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a 15-year-old who was part of a group of kids who put a transgender teen in the hospital is tried as an adult, the SVU team wonders whether the punishment fits the crime.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a starving toddler is found wandering the streets, detectives are led to a home where another child is in grave condition; Chief Dodds (Peter Gallagher) suggests that Benson's squad may be undergoing changes.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An unarmed black man is shot during the pursuit of a suspect, raising racial tensions; Barba must indict the three officers involved -- who claim they followed procedure.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins' mother throws her a baby shower; the team's investigation into the rape of a violinist by her colleague leads to Rollins' fugitive sister; Sgt. Mike Dodds reports for his first day.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When the 13-year-old daughter of a reality-TV family discovers she's pregnant, the team investigates.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and the team are approached by a woman who claims she's witnessed a murder - but the case is turned on its head when they discover the eyewitness has a disturbing secret of her own.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: While investigating a bank robbery, Sue and the team discover it was robbed five years ago - has the robber returned to the scene of the crime? The clue trail leads them to a surprising twist.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue is offered an exciting new high-profile job at the FBI - but is torn when she realizes it means leaving her FBI teammates and friends, including twelve-year-old Amanda, behind.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sheltered, young, and deaf, Sue Thomas lands her first job with the FBI. She's relegated to the tedious task of filing fingerprints until she catches the eye of Agent Jack Hudson.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue finds some on the team are not as welcoming to a deaf woman, her unique lipreading ability and her hearing dog Levi as Agent Jack Hudson.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue's first FBI assignment thrusts her into the high stakes, high-pressure world of investigating an anonymous bomb threat at an oil refinery.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue is swept into the maelstrom of a dangerous assignment when the FBI has to protect a visiting dignitary who has been targeted for assassination by a terrorist cell.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth's location and condition becomes more mysterious when it's discovered that FBI Agent Miller (Kim Raver) has been hiding vital information; Arastoo makes a significant decision.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When Brennan officially returns to work at the Jeffersonian and Booth resumes his position at the FBI, remains are found at a fish farm; Hodgins encourages Angela to exhibit her photography work; Cam faces a difficult decision.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs suspects that a 14-year-old who stopped a home invasion is holding back information; Vance and Fornell head to London as part of the case involving the escaped British spy.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The FBI and M16 continue their international manhunt as the escaped British spy leaves one agent fighting for his life in the ICU.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: NCIS, FBI and MI6 continue the worldwide manhunt for a British spy who is targeting current and former agents.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates a car explosion with a connection to an agent who went missing six months earlier; Gibbs asks NCIS Special Agent Alex Quinn to shadow his team.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While investigating a murder at a Quantico reunion, the NCIS team uncovers a bomb plot and a long-running theft ring; Torres and Quinn adapt to their new lives on Gibbs' team.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a Marine falls to her death, the woman's doctor (Laura San Giacomo) tells Gibbs that she thinks the woman was murdered.

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a missing M16 officer is linked to the death of a petty officer, Gibbs sends Quinn and Bishop to investigate; Quinn recounts a painful ordeal that caused her to leave field work.

programme.desc: Torres breaks protocol when he learns that a witness in an NCIS case is wanted by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement; Abby, Bishop and McGee try to woo Tony DiNozzo Sr. to sublet Tony's old apartment.

programme.desc: When a transient man is gunned downed, the only eyewitness Mobile detectives have is also a suspect; reluctant witnesses, defendants pointing fingers at each other, and a surprise ruling leaves a novice prosecutor struggling to clinch his case.

programme.desc: With over 7,500 hours investigating the mystery; top D.B. Cooper expert Eric Ulis believes that he's found the true location where Cooper landed during his daring dive.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A powerful union activist disappears from a Detroit suburb; 45 years later, it remains one of the most notorious missing person cases of all time; the mystery of Jimmy Hoffa's disappearance features more twists and turns than a Hollywood movie.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists ask whether the truth of humankind's origins can be found in the mysterious relics revered by ancient cultures for thousands of years and found on display in museums, temples and churches.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Mysterious relics and sealed vaults may have been hidden on purpose and protected by an extraterrestrial source.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Exploring the theory that mankind's technological savvy comes from the work of extraterrestrials that watch Earth from outer space; inside the Inca legend, The Book of Enoch, that describes the Watchers descending to Earth to aid our advancement.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Scientists have found thousands of planets capable of supporting life; possibly answering the question of whether or not human life is alone in the universe.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Deadly forests. Haunted houses. Mountains where visitors never return alive. Are there such things as "evil places"?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Abandoned cities. Ancient cultures nearly erased by time. And colossal empires that simply vanished without a trace. How does a civilization become "lost?"

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have believed that certain places, things, or even people can be tainted with dark curses. Ominous lakes that morph into watery graves.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Many have insisted that simple stones can do everything from choosing a king to causing death.Â So, what is it about rocks and stones that inspires some people to worship them?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout history, humans have buried their dead in caves or chambers, in pyramids or in some form of a tomb; ancient tombs were visual memorials for the dead; in China, a vast necropolis was constructed as a way to connect to the afterlife.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether the ancients had scientific knowledge lost to time; how and why they fashioned remarkable feats of engineering.

programme.desc: Examining various events that are said to have been directed by the hand of the Almighty, such as the Great Flood, the Plagues of Egypt, Sodom and Gomorrah, and Moses parting the Red Sea.

programme.desc: Throughout history, many have believed that certain places, things, or even people can be tainted with dark curses. Ominous lakes that morph into watery graves.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Many have insisted that simple stones can do everything from choosing a king to causing death.Â So, what is it about rocks and stones that inspires some people to worship them?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout history, humans have buried their dead in caves or chambers, in pyramids or in some form of a tomb; ancient tombs were visual memorials for the dead; in China, a vast necropolis was constructed as a way to connect to the afterlife.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether the ancients had scientific knowledge lost to time; how and why they fashioned remarkable feats of engineering.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Examining various events that are said to have been directed by the hand of the Almighty, such as the Great Flood, the Plagues of Egypt, Sodom and Gomorrah, and Moses parting the Red Sea.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Deadly forests. Haunted houses. Mountains where visitors never return alive. Are there such things as "evil places"?

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Police have few clues in the disappearance of University of Iowa student Mollie Tibbetts until a local resident shares his garage surveillance camera footage; police later arrest Cristhian Bahena Rivera, who is living in the country illegally.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Police body cam video captures the cries of an Army sergeant as she cradles her dying husband in her arms; despite the happy outward appearance of the young military couple, investigators soon accuse the wife of directing a murder-for-hire plot.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Popular college senior Samantha Josephson goes missing after a night of socializing at a bar area popular with students; tragically, her body is found 24 hours later with more than 100 stab wounds.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: When Brandi Peters and her three children were found murdered, prosecutors pointed the ﬁnger at her ex, but as the trial got underway, an imprisoned drug dealer came forward.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: Investigating the world's most notorious murders, going inside the minds and motives of the killers who committed them; experts from the FBI, Scotland Yard and leading homicide investigators review crime scene evidence.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: When a law school student is strangled to death in her bed, detectives discover that someone she knew extremely well had been secretly watching her for months by videotaping her through her second story window.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A clerk, turned prolific serial killer, flies under the radar for years, but when law enforcement finally tracks him down, they discover he's far more demented than they ever could have imagined.

programme.title: Killer Mysteries
programme.desc: A group of high school outcasts are on the run through the southeastern United States after their leader commits a savage double homicide. Cops finally catch the thrill-seeking teens, only to find out they’re a makeshift vampire cult.

programme.title: Killer Mysteries

programme.title: It Takes a Killer

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Sharks are the ultimate underwater predator, but why? A skunks odor can be dilluted to10 parts per billion and still makes your eyes water. How slow is the 3 toed sloth? From the depth of the oceans to the tops of the trees, this week on Animal Science.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The bald eagle can travel up to100 miles per hour during an aerial attack on unsespecting prey. Jellyfish are equipped with the deadliest venom on earth. Plus, a camels mouth is built to eat almost anything!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Desolate landscapes as far as the eye can see, temperatures ranging from below freezing to 130 degrees and more. These are some of the most extreme environments in the entire Planet. This week, we head in to the desert.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Philippe explores the various ways our planet is always in motion. Visit the volcanic Mt. Saint Helens in Washington, where the movement of the earth's crust caused this mountain to erupt and create devastation in 1980. Plus, a look at oceans and waterways.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we meet the animals of Africa. We'll see how the zebra is able to use its stripes as camouflage against its colorblind nemesis. Explore the engineering of a giraffe's neck, and feel the power of a hyena's jaws.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: An Elephant seals nose inflates to amplify its roar, which can be heard up to a mile away! Plus, African wild dog have one of the most powerful bite forces on Earth! Giant ant eaters w/o teeth have 2 foot long tongues and can eat 30k insects per day!

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 6/13/2012 - Matt Cain throws the first perfect game in Giants franchise history, striking out 14 batters as the Giants pummel the Astros 10-0 in San Francisco.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Felix Hernandez was flawless against the Rays to throw the first perfect game in Mariners history.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The 2008 MLB All-Star Game at Yankee Stadium was marked as the longest All-Star Game in history. It ended after 4 hours and 50 minutes in the 15th inning on a walk-of sacrifice fly from Michael Young.

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: Spotlighting the careers and moments of top Puerto Rican players like Roberto Clemente, Iván Rodriguez and more.

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: Relive top moments from 1995-1999, including Cal Ripken Jr. becoming baseball's Iron Man, David Wells' perfection in pinstripes, and more.

programme.title: Prime 9
programme.desc: Who will make the cut for the nine greatest second basemen of all time? It’s time to find out. See where you stand on the Prime 9 reboot

programme.title: Prime 9
programme.desc: Who will make the cut for the nine greatest second basemen of all time? It’s time to find out. See where you stand on the Prime 9 reboot

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Host Michelle Beadle tours historic Wrigley Field, home of the Chicago Cubs.

programme.title: Baseball's Seasons
programme.desc: After the strike of 1994, the 1995 season is highlighted by Cal Ripken Jr. breaking Lou Gehrig's record, the Mariners saving baseball in Seattle and a matchup between the Braves and Indians in the World Series.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: For years the Braves ruled the NL like no team since the Dodgers of the 1950s. And like Brooklyn, Atlanta found itself turned away time and again in October. With the additions of youth and spunk, it was time for the Team of the 90s to get their Title.

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: Look back at classic game endings including Joe Carter's three-run homer in the 1993 World Series and more.

programme.title: All-Century Team
programme.desc: With rare archival footage, exclusive interviews, and compelling stories, the Major League Baseball All-Century Team honors the greatness of these all-time heroes through the awe-filled words of teammates, opponents, and even their own recollections.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Kris Bryant becomes the first player since 1913 with three homers and two doubles in the same game.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Carlos Correa's go-ahead home run gives the Astros Game 1 ALCS win

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The Cardinals score 10 runs in the 6th inning en route to a 12-11 victory against the Reds

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: Turn back time with some of the biggest highlights in Major League history, including Hank Aaron's 715th homer, Kerry Wood's shutout game and more.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: MVP Alfonso Soriano hits a three-run homer off Roger Clemens in the 1st inning to lead the AL over the NL in the 2004 All-Star Game at Minute Maid Park.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Pujols goes 5-for-5 with three home runs in a comeback win against the Cubs.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1975 matchup between the Reds and the Red Sox. After trailing 3-0 in Game 7, Cincinnati battled back to take the lead in the 9th and capture their first World Series of the decade, giving birth to the "Big Red Machine"

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The American League and National league face off in a pitching duel for four innings of the 1980 All-Star Game until Fred Lynn crushes a two-run homer. The NL would take the lead for good in the 6th.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Dallas Braden's perfect game on May 9, 2010 for the A's against the Rays saw him retire all 27 batters faced, with just 109 pitches. It was the 19th perfect game in MLB history, solidifying Braden's place in baseball history.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: José Iglesias goes 3-for-5 and collects six RBIs with a three-run homer and a two-run single.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The Braves take down the Dodgers in Game 2 of the 2021 NLCS

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The client is on board with the chosen shade of green, and the car moves into the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A past client returns with a 1965 Mustang Fastback, and though he likes the stock look, he wants to upgrade the drivetrain, instrumentation and as many modern amenities as possible; the assembly team gets a crash course in engine tuning.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An active-duty serviceman and his father are finally ready to finish their 1951 Ford pickup.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1951 pickup is painted and ready for final assembly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Fixing a '32 Ford that caught fire after an accident.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave designs a Mustang for the ages to compete in the Optima Challenge; the build includes a new front facia and hood and redesigning the rear end.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1965 Mustang makes its way through the metal shop and is now ready for paint and final assembly; making it function will test even the Kindig crew.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave has decided that the time is right to design his own concept car from scratch; it's a huge job that involves all the different departments in the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: All the Concept Corvette's elements are built and assembled, but Dave needs to find a buyer; a rock 'n' roll icon brings his '34 Ford coupe to the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repaint of a 1964 Corvette careens into much more after Dave upsells the client on a couple of design features, and the crew finds some damage underneath the original paint; the owner of an iconic Ford GTX1 tasks Dave with solving a dilemma.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An abandoned 1967 C10 that has been sitting for years has been sold to a client who wants a few new touches, but closer inspection reveals more work is needed.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave convinces the client to make the 1967 C10 truck into a convertible; Kevin takes on a new personal project with a Cadillac Escalade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The engineering on the convertible C10 works in theory, but making it work in practice is the next step; a team brings in a replica 1967 Cobra with a bad engine.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Of all the different years and generations of the VW Bug, there is one that stands out among the rest -- the Hebmüller; there are maybe 200 of them left, so in addition to being hard to find, they are truly the holy grail of VWs.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The build continues, and the challenge is to keep what makes the car a Hebmueller intact, while taking bold steps to turn it into a hot rod. Dave keeps the traditional two-tone exterior, but modifying it to an automatic is a huge test for the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Normally when Kindig-It Design attends a car show, their cars are the ones being judged. But this time around, Dave and Kev hold the keys and will have to select the top 10 builders out of the hundreds of cars that arrive for the show.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave's clients have owned a car since they got married 25 years ago and want it restored so they can enjoy it for another 25. While the shop isn't really into straight restorations, adding some custom pieces and paint makes them "say yes" to the pro.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is thrilled with the latest build, while KevDogg is barely lukewarm; Dave has done double-cab VWs, Bugs and Karmann Ghias, but now he is taking on something completely different, and even more rare.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Matching the two-tone paint job is the challenge of the day as the '53 Barn Door Deluxe build carries on; custom trim, a new, more powerful engine, 22 windows and a custom interior all come together to make this surprise worth the wait.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the guys at Kindig-It proved they could execute Dave's vision of his production Corvette, but now that a few have sold, they have to get them completely finished.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team put the finishing touches on the first-ever Kindig CF Corvettes to complete a lifelong dream; however, the clients argue about who will get the first one, all in advance of a once-in-a-lifetime debut at SEMA.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin, who have been an absolute treat for automotive enthusiasts for years, come back to the SEMA show with something special on their minds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Beatles fanatic challenges Dave to paint a modern Rolls-Royce to match the car John Lennon commissioned in the late 1960s.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show as far east as they have ever gone and head to Lake George, New York, for the Adirondack Nationals; the town shuts down for the car show, attracting some of the best on the east coast.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1970s Pantera is an iconic sportscar, but once Dave gets his hands on it, the style will never be the same; the client has given Dave free rein to change the car as he sees fit, but has one request: he is 6'4" and can't comfortably get in it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: With the whole team in agreement over the body mods, the crew must make the designs into reality; their list of tasks include bulging out the fenders, creating a spider-shaped exhaust, executing the stretch and getting the car to body.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Pantera is almost done, but nothing is simple with this car; Dave and Kev get a chance to upgrade their semi rig.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1971 Chevy Nova with tremendous pedigree arrives at the shop to get classic Kindig-It styling cues; Dave wants to make this car into a hardtop; tucked-in bumpers, front valance and a new engine provide a good test for the crew.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Will makes miracles happen, and Dave decides to make a wholesale change to the car's color; challenges mount at each stage of the build, and the upholstery shop changes up their routine as the client arrives for a reveal years in the making.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: While the shop perfects its process in building the CF1s, word about the car spreads and potential buyers line up; the latest client has a big problem when he can't choose the perfect color combination.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show to the Midwest, as more than 2,500 cars descend on the Summit Motorsports drag strip for a weekend of fun; Kev gets a ride in a lean, mean drag racing machine; Dave steps up his autocross game.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client enlists Dave on a mission from God to make his dreams of a father/son road trip along Route 66 come true; getting the client's mechanically unsound reproduction of the Bluesmobile ready for the road will test the crew's mettle.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Kevin Schiele breathes new life into a semi-hauler by giving it a visual and functional upgrade that impeccably reflects his expertise in trucks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave finally realizes one of his dreams by opening the Kindig Academy.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team determine that a '69 Camaro requires a full rebuild.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Camaro build hits a snag as the crew tries to get the engine dialed in.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repair turns into a full rebuild for a show-ready '35 Roadster.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop hits the road with their freshest builds for a show in Colorado.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The owner of an iconic '55 Nomad wants to boost the power with a blower.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Rick Mezich from "Deadliest Catch" tests Dave's design prowess on his CF1.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Hummer comes in for a 4WD conversion, engine swap, interior and paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop has a busy week prepping for the 2022 SEMA show in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave makes modifications to the latest CF1 and announces a pinewood derby.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew gears up for the last car show of the year in Scottsdale, Arizona.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A beat-up truck arrives, but underneath all the rust lies a hidden gem.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The body work on the C10 is where the art of the build truly comes out.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Challenges still lie ahead as the C10 moves into final assembly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: After a nationwide search to find the best metal fabrication prospects around, Dave Kindig and KevDogg have invited 12 people to the shop to compete for one job at Kindig-It Design.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The remaining competitors pair up for a challenge to create a signature Kindig-It build feature; teamwork is critical, and the team that can't figure it out will pack their bags.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave and Kev divide the group into two teams, and explain the day's assignment; the teams must navigate a tricky exhaust challenge; the losing team will have to make a difficult choice.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Project managers are chosen; designing and executing a wing on a '68 Camaro trunk lid.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: A rusted out, dented fender needs repair, and at the last minute, Dave and Kev throw a curveball.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The ultimate job interview is down to four candidates, and the next test will see how well they can handle a staple project at Kindig-It Design; even with the instructions available, this challenge is not as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave challenges the remaining three players to fabricate a grill from design to execution, with the winners getting a spot in the finale.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The final two are ready to prove themselves; Dave and Kev throw another curveball.

programme.desc: Fred Williams rescues an old ranch Jeep in Texas.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day
programme.desc: Fred ventures from Texas to New Mexico for his next vehicle restoration.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day
programme.desc: Fred and his three dogs travel on a road trip across America.

programme.title: Man From Del Rio
programme.desc: Thanks to his prowess with a gun, Dave Robles (Anthony Quinn) makes a place for himself in Mesa, becoming sheriff after out-dueling several gunfighters in a single day. But Robles, a Mexican, seethes over the town's racism, and is warned by kindly nurse Estella (Katy Jurado) that without his gun, he would not last very long. That theory is put to the test when the new sheriff injures his wrist fighting with Ed Bannister (Peter Whitney), who upon learning about it, challenges Robles to a duel.

programme.title: The Ride Back
programme.desc: Determined to redeem his life as a failure, Sheriff Chris Hamish (William Conrad) crosses the Mexican border to find outlaw named Kallen (Anthony Quinn) and extradite him to Texas for a fair trial. Hamish arrests Kallen, who doubts the sheriff's ability to bring him to justice and makes several attempts to escape. But when they run into a group of murderous Apaches, Hamish and Kallen must fight together to survive, and they form an unlikely friendship.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When a family of Quakers are targeted by locals and Adam and his new companion, Sam, offer to escort them, Sam devises a plan to rob them instead.

programme.title: Bonanza

programme.title: Annie Oakley

programme.title: Run of the Arrow
programme.desc: Dejected by the defeat of the Confederacy, O'Meara (Rod Steiger) heads west toward Sioux territory. After surviving a test called the "Run of the Arrow," he is accepted as one of the Oglala Sioux people and marries Yellow Moccasin (Sara Montiel). The couple create a family together and live contentedly until Capt. Clark (Brian Keith) arrives with a group of cavalry, hoping to build a fort nearby. O'Meara acts as a scout for the troops until their wary peace is shattered.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Lucas refuses to sell his land, Mr. Prescott will stop at nothing to to change his mind. He hires men to try to persuade Lucas, but he refuses.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark's careless actions cause the death of a friend. Unable to accept the truth, he blames the rifle and runs away from home. Soon, he is faced with a tough decision.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Nils Swenson takes the marshal's place for a few days while Micah is away. To maintain peace, Nils insists that anyone coming into town must turn in their weapons.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas's self-confidence begins to slip away when he misses an easy shot that could have cost Mark his life.

programme.title: War Drums
programme.desc: Mangas Coloradas (Lex Barker), an Apache chief, and white trader Luke Fargo (Ben Johnson) are bound by friendship and their mutual love for Riva (Joan Taylor), a Mexican-Native American girl rescued from horse thieves. Riva marries Mangas, who teaches her the warrior's ways, and she later warns the Apaches of an ambush by white soldiers. When Fargo, who did not intend an attack, is injured, Riva helps him -- a kindness he must choose whether or not to return when war with the Apaches erupts.

programme.desc: At a disused railway station, three men -- a con artist (Edward G. Robinson), a preacher (William Shatner) and a prospector (Howard Da Silva) -- discuss the recent trial and sentencing of the outlaw Juan Carrasco (Paul Newman) for the murder of a man (Laurence Harvey) and the rape of his wife (Claire Bloom). In their recounting, the three explore the conflicting testimonies of the parties involved in the crimes. Disconcerting new questions arise with each different version of the event.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: 20 Greatest Hits

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: S01:E01 - Episode 1

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: S01:E02 - Episode 2

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
In tonight's final programme Gordon returns to Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater in Brighton where he oversaw one of the most spectacular changes of fortune at a single venue. Owner CHARITA JONES was producing a menu of irresistible unique classics from the Deep South, but at the same facing financial disaster. The punters were missing, and so was her business acumen. But Gordon succeeded in shutting her out of the kitchen, getting the chef back on the boil and putting the soul back into the business.
Today Charita is fully-booked round the clock and bursting out of the Soul Shack to take on the 110-seater Momma Cherri's Big House. But expansion brings a different set of challenges, and she's still struggling to control her staff and manage her success. Has she got what it takes to make the next step up, or will she be forced to rethink her grand plans?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's penultimate programme Gordon returns to La Riviera - now renamed Abstract - a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~£8000 a week to run, the place boasted top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff, all of them on a mission to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of the haggis. But the locals weren't biting and the restaurant was empty most nights. Gordon's recipe for survival forced them to tone down their act and demystify the menu to get the punters in. Today the restaurant's return to form has led to plans for expansion. Loic is still there, and now he's been promoted to Executive Chef he will oversee any new ventures. But can he continue to resist a return to French frills, and has he managed to pull off his own personal ambition, a Michelin star?

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E05 - Episode 5

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E06 - Episode 6

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.desc: S02:E01 - Vietnam

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Gordon last left Laurence knowing that he had simplified his menu to have clean, simple, honest, traditional food using local produce. Surely this was enough to bring back the locals and win back the faith of the ex-pats.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: With landlord Brian's continual stress and interference in the kitchen, which Gordon believed was one of the main reasons for the inefficiencies of The Fenwick Arms, and now the added pressure of new competition, it's no wonder the pub is in trouble. Gordon's not going to like what's happened in his absence.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation’s gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.desc: Tyler and Sara pitch leeches for shallow water walleyes in tough conditions. Keeping the presentation horizontal is critical for these spooky fish!

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Jimmy is taking the boys on a field trip to the Lonestar state to show them a thing or two about turkey hunting.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Sail Kings

programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Charlie Scoble & Donnie Lang on a mother ship trip aboard the “TACKLE CENTER” to the Dry Tortugas

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. John Hagen & Capt. James Hagen in search of Sailfish inIslamorada.

programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Sammy Millazo Fishing Offshore Islamorada.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.”

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP brings BASS Elite Series angler Cooper Gallant down to Tropic Star Lodge to target Mahi Mahi run n gun style.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Absolute tuna insanity off the Jersey Coast as Nick joins the crew of the Mushin and the Mama Tried for both day and night trips to chunk, troll and jig for yellowfin tuna.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From country music star Brian Kelley’s big 56’ Sunny Briggs Sportfishing Yacht, to getting caught in a storm aboard a small Hurricane deck boat in the Gulf of Mexico, this episode of Stomping Grounds has host Ryan McVinney exploring boat culture in Florida’s Panhandle region, from the Emerald Coast to The Big Bend and the Forgotten Coast. Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: The final qualifier takes place out of Cardinal, Ontario on the mighty St. Lawrence River.

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. The adventure continues with his family as they enjoy a thrilling hydrofoil ride in Jupiter, Florida, blending fishing excitement with family fun on the water.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Throughout the season we get a lot of footage that never makes it on the show and isn't enough for a whole episode, so we put it together here in Bits & Bites.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Prepare to embark on an awe-inspiring aquatic journey as "Legendary Pursuits: Conquering the Depths of Port Saint Joe" takes you on an epic fishing adventure like no other. Join us as we cast off into the pristine waters of Port Saint Joe, a coastal paradise brimming with marine treasures waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss travels to Jacksonville, FL, to fish dock lights and low tide waters with Capt. Andrew Mizell.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to Crystal river to chase Redfish in his new Cayo Skiff.

programme.title: We Caught That
programme.desc: In this episode, Capt. Jason heads out with his longtime hunting buddy to fish in Keaton Beach. Afterward, they head over to try and shoot some feral hogs on private land in North Florida.

programme.title: We Caught That
programme.desc: In this week’s episode Capt. Jason Dozier and His buddy Cody Williams head out of Key West to fish for pelagic and dive for Spiny lobster.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself in unfamiliar waters targeting the fish of ten thousand casts.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Jon Cooper & Joe Neber Sail fishing in the beautiful waters ofCosta Rica.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: In this episode of Flats Class, Captain C.A. is debuting the brand new Power Pole MOVE and fishing for redfish.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell head to Louisiana AKA "The Sportsman's Paradise" to kick off Season 4 of "Dr. Duck presented by Federal's Black Cloud." They'll be hanging with good friend Gem Ceasar at Cypress Cove Landing for a full Cajun experience.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys at Realtree get together to kick off the 2023-24 Federal Black Cloud waterfowl season. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and friends at Realtree put on an epic early season teal hunt in the Louisiana rice fields.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Rigsby Stewart makes a move to punch his tag in Nebraska! Nothing came easy on this hunt! Multiple different weather conditions and wind directions proved challenging!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Last season, Black Cloud joined W.E. Phillips at his Duck Club in the Arkansas Timber. W.E. Phillips was one of the original "Duck Men" in the classic Duck Commander Duck Men series with the Robertson family. On this hunt, W.E. tells stories of the old times and shares some CRAZY duck hunting strategies.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell are gearing up for duck season. They discuss their must-have gear items for fall. Are you ready?

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Road Trips crew is out hunting from Iowa down to Georgia! The guys are joined by Joel Burham of Whitetail Fit and Josh Sparks of MidWest Whitetail. The pre rut action is getting hot and Charlie Thomas puts down his hit list 10 pointer!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys stay up all night while driving from Canada to catch a duck hunt in Oklahoma. Are they crazy?We've taken you on plenty of Oklahoma timber duck hunts in the past, but the state is also known for plains duck hunting as well. The northwestern corner of the state is a bit different, and the guys oftentimes hunt small cattle ponds, creeks, and sometimes puddles. Regardless, they usually kill species such as mallards, pintails, widgeons, and gadwalls. Here's the latest from the Sooner state.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew travels to Louisiana to hunt with the Realtree waterfowl pro staff. This episode features Rusty Creasey, manager of the famed Coco Cola woods in Arkansas. Rusty takes a day off during the split to hunt with Realtree’s Stephen McNelly and Cole Barthel. Be sure to subscribe and follow along as we feature duck hunting Legends like Jim Ronquest, Si Roberston, Dr. Duck, Justin Martin, and more.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Realtree's Ben McDonald gets luck again on his first sit in Nebraska. This time he rattles in an absolute giant whitetail into Bow Range.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: After a successful opening weekend, the crew heads out to work on controlling the doe population only to have an encounter with a huge 8-pointer. Should Bryan Brown have shot?

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in for an adrenaline-packed adventure in Croatia as he targets the elusive Kri Kri Ibex and Mouflon. With expert guides and unwavering determination, Mark navigates rugged terrain and thrilling hunts, showcasing the excitement and skill of the hunting industry.As his time in Croatia winds down, the episode captures the essence of ethical practices and the intense pursuit that defines this exhilarating sport. Don’t miss the epic conclusion to Mark’s expedition, where passion, skill, and the thrill of the hunt converge in unforgettable moments.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.
Kris Seymour and family target a couple big Kansas whitetails!

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: The Hunted Land & Sea is in Montana hunting for whitetail deer with Harris Hunts. Kristian Hansen and Gerry Holland have tags and Kim Hansen is tagging along for the hunt. Part Two.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Turkey Hunter
programme.desc: Russell, Seth, Reno and Lamar kick off the season in South Texas with 6 Rio Grande Longbeards in one hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Notoriously nocturnal and living in some of the densest cover imaginable, the black-tailed deer is generally known to be more ghostly than the most challenging old whitetails.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Join in as Randy and Cody are hard at work on the Raven Planting some Big Tine borderline on one of their favorite plots on the farm. Then learn all about their summer time clover plot maintenance routine.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: Behind the Draw
programme.desc: Mike makes a wild stalk on a beautiful velvet mule deer buck. The entire week was a week to remember filled with many ups and downs. We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 1 of this epic Montana bowhunt!

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Brad Rucks heads to Illinois to test out the new 360 Buckhammer straightwall cartridge.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Brad Rucks gets a chance to punch a long awaited Wisconsin sturgeon tag and then chats with the local DNR to learn about sturgeon spawning season.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Father/son duo Brad and Noah Rucks are after the same giant whitetail that's making regular appearances on their family farm.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Retired army nurse Linda Powel wins a dream hunt in Texas hosted by Record Rack Deer feed. What's the catch? Linda has never hunted a day in her life!

programme.title: Modern Hunter

programme.desc: Tyler Jordan's road trip continues in Illinois. The guys head to the legendary Grigsby Farm. After multiple encounters with a big deer, Jordan is finally able to put a great buck on the ground

programme.desc: Join Josh Calhoon on Goin’ Coastal TV as he takes Big Gus on one of the most epic topwater bites ever caught on camera!

programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Paul Ross.

programme.desc: Road trip time! Embrace the frigid temps with CA on this special episode, fishing for the cape Fear Slam.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA fishes with Richard Black in Islamorada. This guy can do it all. Rain or shine, no fish is safe.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach and Carson Wentz chase long beards throughout the Midwest.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach and Carson Wentz head to Texas for their annual hunt with the Nature’s Eye crew.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Part of our North Dakota crew joins us in Illinois to shoot green heads in The Land of Lincoln.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: An unusually warm Iowa November led John to hunting clover food plots and a bit of deja vu. A buck John passed several times in 2022 would resurface on the same plot, and walk the same path as he did exactly 1 year prior to the day, only 30 mins off. Do you believe deer will repeat themselves? This episode might make you think so!!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.desc: Absolute tuna insanity off the Jersey Coast as Nick joins the crew of the Mushin and the Mama Tried for both day and night trips to chunk, troll and jig for yellowfin tuna.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From country music star Brian Kelley’s big 56’ Sunny Briggs Sportfishing Yacht, to getting caught in a storm aboard a small Hurricane deck boat in the Gulf of Mexico, this episode of Stomping Grounds has host Ryan McVinney exploring boat culture in Florida’s Panhandle region, from the Emerald Coast to The Big Bend and the Forgotten Coast. Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader
